msContents.summary: The Saptavāra ("Seven Days") usually incorporates seven dhāraṇīs, the Vasudhārā, Vajravidāraṇā, Gaṇapatihṛdaya, Uṣṇīṣavijayā, Parṇaśavarī or Prajñāpāramitā, Mārīcī, and Grahamātṛkā. This collection associates each dhāraṇī with a specific day of the week, a tradition going back to at least the sixteenth century in Nepal. This paper manuscript, dated 1740 CE, contains the Saptavāra starting with the Vasundhārānāmāṣṭottaraśataka in the place of the usual Vasudhārādhāraṇī.

msItem.title: Saptavāra
msItem.rubric: [1v1] $ oṃ namo bhagavatyai āryyavasudhārāyai || oṃ ādityadevatāyai || [1v2] namo ratnatrayāyi ḥ |||
msItem.incipit: [1v2] dirvyarūpi surūpī ca | śunyarūpi ra2va1pradā | va[1v3]sudhari vasudhāri ca | vasuśrīśrīkarivarā | dharani dhārani dhātā [1v4] | saraṇabhaktivatsarāḥ prajñāpāramitādevi | prajñā śrībauddhavā[1v5]dhani ||
msItem.finalRubric: [10r2] || i[10r3]ti vajavidāraṇo nāma dhāraṇī | paramahṛdayaṃ mūramantradvi¦[[10r4]tiyā ca parisamāpta || @ ||
msItem.rubric: [10r4] || $ oṃ namo bhagava[10r5]tyai || āryyaśrīgaṇapatihṛdayāyai || śrī aṃgāradevatāyai || namo' [10v1] śrīratnatrayāya ||
[14r1] $ oṃ namo bhagavatyai āryyaśrīuṣṇīṣa[14r2]vijayāyai ḥ śrōbuddhāyai ḥ
[19v2] $ oṃ namo bhagavatyai āryyaśrīpannaśavalītārāyai ḥ | namo ratna[19v3]trayāya ḥ || śrībṛhaspatīdevatāyai ḥ || namo śrīamitābhāya ||
msItem.finalRubric: [22r2] || ^^ || āryyaparṇṇaśavalīma[22r3hāmāyāpraṇādā || iti śrīpiśāścīpaṇṇaśavalī nāma dhāranī¦[22r4]hṛdayamūlamantra parisamāpta || @ || ^^ || ^^^
msItem.rubric: [22r5] $ oṃ namo bhagavatyai āryyamāricidevatāyai ḥ || śukladevatāyai |
msItem.finalRubric: [25r3] āryyaśrīmāre[25r4]devatāyā | nāma dhāraṇī paramahṛdayaṃ | mūlamantra parisamāpta [25r5] || @ ||
msItem.rubric: [25r5] @ || $ oṃ namo bhagavatyai āryyagrahamātṛkāyai [25v1] ḥ śrīśanidyavatāyāi ||
msItem.explicit: [42r2] atha te sarvvagrahāḥ śādhu bhagavānn iti kṛ[42r3]tvā || praṇamyantahito'bhūvana || @ || idam avocad bhagavān āttamanā||[42r4]s te ca bhikṣavas te ca bodhisattvā mahāsattvā || sā ca sarvvāvatīparṣa || sadevamānu[42r5]ṣāsura||garuḍagandhamvaś ca loko bhagavato || bhāṣitaḥm abhyanandan iti || @ ||
msItem.colophon: [42v1] śubha [42v2] rikhitaṃ istalamṣumahāvehāre vasthita | bhikṣuśrījñānandedronajuro || ja[42v3]di śuddhaṃm asudhaṃ vā śuddhaṇiya mahāburddha || śubha samvat_ 860 mti āśvādha¦[42v4]śukladvādasikundusidhayakādinajuro || @ || śubha maṅgalaṃ bhavaṃntu [42v5] sarvvadā kāraṃm astu || @ || @ ||

physDesc.p: Composite manuscript consisting of two codicological units (1 folio of the same dimension has been inserted to supply the missing folio that would have been numbered as 20).

history.provenance: Bought by Wright, Daniel Dr. D. Wright in 1875.

acquisition.date: 13 October 1875 (ULIB 7/3/55; 10 October 1875 written in pencil on f. 1r).

availability.p: Entry to read in the Library is permitted only on presentation of a valid reader's card for admissions procedures contact Cambridge University Library Admissions).
